docs.summary: create multiple Contents in a single request. Works synchronously.

docs.summary: deletes multiple Contents in a single request. Works synchronously.

params.name: contents

params.name: returnEntity
params.doc: set to `true` if you wish to receive back the created contents in the response

docs.summary: update multiple Contents in a single request. Works synchronously.

*
Creates a Content.

The request body must include schema-id, entity-id and locale.

extra.description:
Creates a Content with basic info

curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/translation-content/v1/translation-content-entity' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-binary '{
    "content": {
      "loremUppercase": "LOREM UPPERCASE",
      "ipsum": "lorem ipsum",
      "businessAddress": "Pankivska 14a"
  }'

params.name: contentId
params.doc: Id of the Content to delete.

docs.summary:
*
Deletes a Content.

params.name: contentId
params.doc: ID of the Content to retrieve.

docs.summary:
*
Retrieves a Content.

*
Retrieves a list of Contents, given the provided [paging, filtering, and sorting][1].

params.name: content
params.doc: Content to be updated, may be partial.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc:
Set of fields to update.

Fields that aren't included in `fieldMask.paths` are ignored.

docs.summary:

Updates a Content.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Content ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Content ID associated with this event.

members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Content ID associated with this event.

members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
 If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
 If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: resolutions
members.doc: Available resolutions for the video, starting with the optimal resolution.

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. An unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

docs.summary:
`Struct` represents a structured data value, consisting of fields
 which map to dynamically typed values. In some languages, `Struct`
 might be supported by a native representation. For example, in
 scripting languages like JS a struct is represented as an
 object. The details of that representation are described together
 with the proto support for the language.

 The JSON representation for `Struct` is JSON object.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. An unordered map of dynamically typed values.

docs.summary:
`ListValue` is a wrapper around a repeated field of values.

 The JSON representation for `ListValue` is JSON array.

members.name: values
members.doc: Repeated field of dynamically typed values.

members.name: background
members.doc: The text's background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: foreground
members.doc: The text's foreground color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pageâ€™s author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: target
members.doc:
The HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: customData
members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom height value in pixels.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container.

members.name: private
members.doc: Indicates whether the file's source is private.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the file's source.

members.name: id
members.doc: An ID that's resolved to a URL by a resolver function.

members.name: src
members.doc: The source for the media's data.

members.name: duration
members.doc: Media duration in seconds. Only relevant for audio and video files.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: url
members.doc: The source URL for the resource.

members.name: html
members.doc: HTML for embedding a video player. The HTML should have no padding or margins.

members.name: authorName
members.doc: The name of the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: authorUrl
members.doc: The URL for the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: providerName
members.doc: The name of the resource provider.

members.name: providerUrl
members.doc: The URL for the resource provider.

members.name: thumbnailUrl
members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailWidth
members.doc: The width of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailHeight
members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.name: videoUrl
members.doc: The URL for an embedded viedo.

members.name: version
members.doc: The oEmbed version number.  This value must be `1.0`.

members.name: slug
members.doc: The version of the user's name that appears after the `@` character in the mention.

members.name: textStyle
members.doc: Styling for the code block's text.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: border
members.doc: The border color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: background
members.doc: The background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to display on the button.

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:  
 `NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.  
 `FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.  
 `MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF download button is disabled.

members.name: disablePrint
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF print button is disabled.

members.name: src
members.doc: The source for the file's data.

members.name: horizontalScroll
members.doc: Sets whether horizontal scroll is enabled.

members.name: numberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on full size screens.

members.name: mobileNumberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on mobile screens.

members.name: targetSize
members.doc: Desirable dimension for each item in pixels (behvaior changes according to gallery type)

members.name: crop
members.doc: Sets how item images are cropped.

members.name: spacing
members.doc: The spacing between items in pixels.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details for images that are links.

members.name: options
members.doc: Options for defining the gallery's appearance.

members.name: disableExpand
members.doc: Sets whether the gallery's expand button is disabled.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the gallery's download button is disabled.

members.name: downsized

members.doc: The URL for the HTML code for the node.

members.name: html
members.doc: The HTML code for the node.

members.name: isAdsense
members.doc: Whether this is an AdSense element. Use `source` instead.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details for images that are links.

members.name: disableExpand
members.doc: Sets whether the image expands to full screen when clicked.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the image's download button is disabled.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the link preview's container.

members.name: address
members.doc: The address to display on the map.

members.name: draggable
members.doc: Sets whether the map is draggable.

members.name: marker
members.doc: Sets whether the location marker is visible.

members.name: streetViewControl
members.doc: Sets whether street view control is enabled.

members.name: zoomControl
members.doc: Sets whether zoom control is enabled.

members.name: viewModeControl
members.doc: Sets whether view mode control is enabled.

members.name: mapType
members.doc: Map type. `HYBRID` is a combination of the `ROADMAP` and `SATELLITE` map types.

members.name: image
members.doc: The image displayed with the option.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times.

members.name: showVoters
members.doc: Sets whether voters are displayed in the vote results.

members.name: showVotesCount
members.doc: Sets whether the vote count is displayed.

members.name: settings
members.doc: The poll's permissions and display settings.

members.name: type
members.doc: The layout for displaying the voting options.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text displayed in the voting options. Text can be displayed either right-to-left or left-to-right.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display the main poll image.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display option images.

members.name: startColor
members.doc: The start color as a hexademical value.

members.name: lastColor
members.doc: The end color as a hexademical value.

members.name: type
members.doc: Background type. For each option, include the relevant details.

members.name: color
members.doc: The background color as a hexademical value.

members.name: image
members.doc: An image to use for the background.

members.name: layout
members.doc: Layout settings for the poll and voting options.

members.name: design
members.doc: Styling for the poll and voting options.

members.name: type
members.doc: The type of Wix App content being embedded.

members.name: itemId

members.name: name
members.doc: The name of the embedded content.

members.name: url

members.name: bookingData

members.name: eventData
members.doc: Data for embedded Wix Events content.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the video's download button is disabled.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the collapsible list's container.

members.name: expandOnlyOne
members.doc: If `true`, only one item can be expanded at a time.

members.name: initialExpandedItems
members.doc: Sets which items are expanded when the page loads.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text in the list. Either left-to-right or right-to-left.

members.name: isQapageData
members.doc: If `true`, The collapsible item will appear in search results as an FAQ.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the oEmbed node's container.

members.name: colsWidthRatio
members.doc: An array representing relative width of each column in relation to the other columns.

members.name: rowsHeight
members.doc: An array representing the height of each row in pixels.

members.name: colsMinWidth
members.doc: An array representing the minimum width of each column in pixels.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header.

members.name: verticalAlignment

members.name: backgroundColor
members.doc: Cell background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: right
members.doc: Right border color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: bottom

members.name: cellStyle

members.name: unit

members.doc: Styling for the audio node's container.

members.name: disableDownload

members.name: html
members.doc: An HTML version of the audio node.

members.doc: Node objects representing a rich content document.

members.name: documentStyle
members.doc: Global styling for header, paragraph, block quote, and code block nodes in the object.

members.name: type
members.doc: Node type. Use `APP_EMBED` for nodes that embed content from other Wix apps. Use `EMBED` to embed content in [oEmbed](https://oembed.com/) format.

members.name: style
members.doc: Padding and background color styling for the node.

members.doc: Data for a code block node.

members.name: htmlData
members.doc: Data for an embedded HTML node.

members.name: linkPreviewData
members.doc: Data for a link preview node.

members.doc: Data for a text node. Used to apply decorations to text.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.List of fields localized in the given language

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Unique identifier that represents a specific entity in the app

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.List of fields localized in the given language

members.name: parentEntityId
members.doc: Optional field that will group in the UI contents with the same group name

members.name: updatedBy
members.doc: Describes the updater identity (site owner / app / auto translator)

members.name: id
members.doc: Field unique identifier. This id must have a matching schema field id

members.name: updaterId
members.doc: Owner of the last change on this field

members.name: published
members.doc: Is content published to live site or not

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the field in the workflow (e.g. pending, reviewed, approved). Value is free text - defined by the client and only stored here.

members.name: textValue
members.doc: Field actual localized content as simple text type

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Use this field to send rich content.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: contentId
members.doc: ID of the Content to retrieve.

members.name: content
members.doc: Content to be updated, may be partial.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc:
Set of fields to update.

Fields that aren't included in `fieldMask.paths` are ignored.

members.name: contentId
members.doc: Id of the Content to delete.

members.doc: set to `true` if you wish to receive back the created contents in the response

members.name: item
members.doc: Only exists if `returnEntity` was set to true in the request

members.doc: Content to be updated, may be partial

members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • AUTO - browser default, eqivalent to `initial`
  • LEFT - Left align
  • RIGHT - Right align
  • CENTER - Center align
  • JUSTIFY - Text is spaced to line up its left and right edges to the left and right edges of the line box, except for the last line.

Possible values are:
  • SELF - Opens the linked document in the same frame as it was clicked (this is default)
  • BLANK - Opens the linked document in a new window or tab
  • PARENT - Opens the linked document in the parent frame
  • TOP - Opens the linked document in the full body of the window

Possible values are:
  • CONTENT - Width matches the content width
  • SMALL - Small Width
  • ORIGINAL - Width will match the original asset width
  • FULL_WIDTH - coast-to-coast display

Possible values are:
  • CENTER - Center Alignment
  • LEFT - Left Alignment
  • RIGHT - Right Alignment

Possible values are:
  • LINK - Regular link button
  • ACTION - Triggers custom action that is defined in plugin configuration by the consumer

Possible values are:
  • SINGLE - Single Line
  • DOUBLE - Double Line
  • DASHED - Dashed Line
  • DOTTED - Dotted Line

Possible values are:
  • LARGE - Large line
  • MEDIUM - Medium line
  • SMALL - Small line

Possible values are:
  • CENTER - Center alignment
  • LEFT - Left alignment
  • RIGHT - Right alignment

Possible values are:
  • NONE - No PDF view
  • FULL - Full PDF view
  • MINI - Mini PDF view

Possible values are:
  • COLLAGE - Collage type
  • MASONRY - Masonry type
  • GRID - Grid type
  • THUMBNAIL - Thumbnail type
  • SLIDER - Slider type
  • SLIDESHOW - Slideshow type
  • PANORAMA - Panorama type
  • COLUMN - Column type
  • MAGIC - Magic type
  • FULLSIZE - Fullsize images type

Possible values are:
  • ROWS - Rows Orientation
  • COLUMNS - Columns Orientation

Possible values are:
  • FILL - Crop to fill
  • FIT - Crop to fit

Possible values are:
  • TOP - Top alignment
  • RIGHT - Right alignment
  • BOTTOM - Bottom alignment
  • LEFT - Left alignment
  • NONE - No thumbnail

Possible values are:
  • HTML
  • ADSENSE

Possible values are:
  • ROADMAP - Roadmap map type
  • SATELITE - Satellite map type
  • HYBRID - Hybrid map type
  • TERRAIN - Terrain map type

Possible values are:
  • CREATOR - Only Poll creator can view the results
  • VOTERS - Anyone who voted can see the results
  • EVERYONE - Anyone can see the results, even if one didn't vote

Possible values are:
  • SITE_MEMBERS - Logged in member
  • ALL - Anyone

Possible values are:
  • LIST - List
  • GRID - Grid

Possible values are:
  • LTR - Left-to-right
  • RTL - Right-to-left

Possible values are:
  • COLOR - Color background type
  • IMAGE - Image background type
  • GRADIENT - Gradiant background type

Possible values are:
  • PRODUCT
  • EVENT
  • BOOKING

Possible values are:
  • FIRST - First item will be expended initally
  • ALL - All items will expended initally
  • NONE - All items collapsed initally

Possible values are:
  • LTR - Left-to-right
  • RTL - Right-to-left

Possible values are:
  • TOP - Top alignment
  • MIDDLE - Middle alignment
  • BOTTOM - Bottom alignment

Possible values are:
  • PX
  • EM

  • PARAGRAPH
